org.xchain.framework.hibernate

Class HibernateLifecycle

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xchain.framework.hibernate.HibernateLifecycle

  • @LifecycleClass(uri="http://www.xchain.org/hibernate/1.0")
public class HibernateLifecycle
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages Hibernate.
    Author:
    Mike Moulton, Devon Tackett, Christian Trimble, John Trimble, Josh Kennedy

      • startLifecycle

        @StartStep(localName="hibernate",
           after="config")
public static void startLifecycle()
        Configures a hibernate using the default hibernate configuration file located on the classpath.

      • stopLifecycle

        @StopStep(localName="hibernate")
public static void stopLifecycle()
        Shutdown the session factory to release all resources.

      • getSessionFactory

        public static org.hibernate.SessionFactory getSessionFactory(javax.xml.namespace.QName name)
        Returns a named Hibernate Session Factory.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the session factory.
        Returns:
        the SessionFactory with the specified name.
        Throws:
        SessionFactoryNotFoundException - if there is not a session factory defined for the specified QName.

      • getCurrentSession

        @Function(localName="current-session")
public static org.hibernate.Session getCurrentSession()
        Get the current Hibernate session. NOTE: This method is not compatible with sessions created with SessionFactory.openSession(). This includes the current <hibernate:session> command, since it uses SessionFactory.openSession() to get its sessions.
        Returns:
        Session

      • getCurrentSession

        @Function(localName="current-session")
public static org.hibernate.Session getCurrentSession(javax.xml.namespace.QName name)
        Gets the current Hibernate session for the named session factory. If the name is null, then getCurrentSession() is returned.
        Returns:
        the current Session for the named SessionFactory.
